node.title: A System for Grouping & Sorting CSS Properties
node.description: Grouping and Sorting CSS properties can make your CSS easier to read and helps with consistency in a team environment. There is no correct answer but something is better than nothing.

node.title: Naming Conventions
node.description: Code is written to be read by humans, not machines. Naming conventions and standard code styling can boost productivity, particularly if working in teams.

node.title: Reactive Extensions (Rx) - Part 3 - Naming Conventions
node.description: Reactive Extensions (Rx) Advantages of using IObservable property naming conventions and comparison between C# events.

node.title: Stop The Brace Wars, Use StyleCop
node.description: StyleCop analyzes C# source code to enforce a set of style and consistency rules. Rehan advocates its use in this thought provoking article.
